fr.dudie.nominatim.client

Interface NominatimClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonNominatimClient

    public interface NominatimClient
    Interface to use the Nominatim Service.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jérémie Huchet, Sunil D S

    • Method Summary

      Reverse geocode the given coordinates.

      Reverse geocode the given coordinates using a specific zoom level
      Address getAddress(int longitudeE6, int latitudeE6)
      A convenience method to do the same as getAddress(double, double) but with int E6 latitude and longitude.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        List<Address> search(String query)
              throws IOException
        Search for results with the given query.

        See also search(NominatimSearchRequest) to obtain more result details.

        Parameters:
        query - the query
        Returns:
        a list of results
        Throws:
        IOException - a communication error occurred
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAddress

        Address getAddress(double longitude,
                   double latitude)
            throws IOException
        Reverse geocode the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        longitude - a longitude
        latitude - a latitude
        Returns:
        an address corresponding to the given longitude and latitude or null if no result found
        Throws:
        IOException - a communication error occurred
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAddress

        Address getAddress(double longitude,
                   double latitude,
                   int zoom)
            throws IOException
        Reverse geocode the given coordinates using a specific zoom level
        Parameters:
        longitude - a longitude
        latitude - a latitude
        zoom - a osm zoom level
        Returns:
        an address corresponding to the given longitude and latitude or null if no result found
        Throws:
        IOException - a communication error occurred
        Since:
        2.0.1

      • getAddress

        Address getAddress(int longitudeE6,
                   int latitudeE6)
            throws IOException
        A convenience method to do the same as getAddress(double, double) but with int E6 latitude and longitude.
        Parameters:
        longitudeE6 - a longitude E6
        latitudeE6 - a latitude E6
        Returns:
        an address corresponding to the given longitude and latitude or null if no result found
        Throws:
        IOException - a communication error occurred
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAddress

        @Deprecated
Address getAddress(String type,
                               long id)
                        throws IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Reverse geocode the given OSM id.
        Parameters:
        type - An OSM type [N|W|R]
        id - An OSM id
        Returns:
        an address corresponding to the given osm type and id pair or null if no result found
        Throws:
        IOException - a communication error occurred
        Since:
        2.0.1
        See Also:
        getAddress(fr.dudie.nominatim.client.request.NominatimReverseRequest)

      • lookupAddress

        List<Address> lookupAddress(List<String> typeId)
                     throws IOException
        This method can be used to lookup addresses with an OSM type and ID
        Parameters:
        typeId - [N|W|R]ID
        Returns:
        a list of addresses corresponding to the given OSM type and ID or null if no result found
        Throws:
        IOException - a communication error occurred
        Since:
        3.2

              throws IOException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a list of results
        Throws:
        IOException - a communication error occurred
        Since:
        3.0

        Address getAddress(NominatimReverseRequest reverse)
            throws IOException
        Reverse geocoding request.
        Parameters:
        reverse - a reverse geocoding request
        Returns:
        an address corresponding to the given longitude and latitude or null if no result found

        3.0

        Parameters:
